graphicslib3D.editors

Class SurfacePatchDialogPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • graphicslib3D.editors.SurfacePatchDialogPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SurfacePatchDialogPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    This helper class implements the visual functionality of the SurfacePatchDialog class by providing mouse listeners, painting algorithms, and methods to manually move a point via scrollbars or textboxes.
    Version:
    1.1 09/02/03
    Author:
    Matt Gross.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • Undo

        public void Undo()
        Will restore a point to its original location before it was dragged by the mouse.

      • updateSelectedPoint

        public boolean updateSelectedPoint(double newVal,
                                   int XYorZ)
        Updates an attribute of a point only if it its isSelected value is true. The XYorZ parameter determines which parameter is to be changed: 0=change x, 1=change y, 2=change Z. If none of the points have been selected, false is returned.

      • updateAllLocations

        public void updateAllLocations()
        Applies the camera VTM to all the points.

      • setCameraPosition

        public void setCameraPosition(double yaw,
                              double pitch,
                              double radius)
        Sets the x,y, and z world coordinates of the camera, using the given pitch and yaw angles. The distance from the origin is fixed. All values are expected to be in radians.

      • getCameraPitch

        public double getCameraPitch()
        Returns the camera's pitch angle in radians.

      • getCameraYaw

        public double getCameraYaw()
        Returns the camera's yaw angle in radians.

      • getCamDistance

        public double getCamDistance()
        Returns camera distance from origin.

      • getZoom

        public double getZoom()
        Returns zoom factor in double form.

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double newZoom)
        Sets the zoom factor; a value of 1.0 means no zoom, a value of 2.0 means double zoom factor, and a value of .5 means 1/2 zoom factor

      • setShowSecondaryAxis

        public void setShowSecondaryAxis(boolean status)
        Sets whether secondary axis should be displayed or not.

      • refreshView

        public void refreshView()
        Forces repaint of surfaceDialogPanel.

      • SplitToLeftRight

        public void SplitToLeftRight(Point3D[][] newLeft,
                             Point3D[][] newRight,
                             Point3D[][] original)
        Function to split the mesh into left and right pieces. This function only works for Bezier patches, and must be replaced if using a B-spline.

      • SplitToTopBottom

        public void SplitToTopBottom(Point3D[][] newLower,
                             Point3D[][] newUpper,
                             Point3D[][] original)
        Function to split the mesh into top and bottom pieces. This function only works for Bezier patches, and must be replaced if using a B-spline.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        All objects of the panel are painted here.

        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent m)
        Updates a point's location if one is selected. Also takes in account the angle of the camera when moving a point to assure that moving the mouse in an upward direction will always give a "positive" value.
        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
